skill.name: typescript-write
skill.description: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use when developing or refactoring TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use whe...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with development guidelines. No executable code, network requests, filesystem access beyond its own files, or command execution capabilities. Risk level is safe.

content.value_statement: Writing TypeScript without established standards leads to inconsistent code and maintenance challenges. This skill provides Metabase coding standards and best practices to help developers write clean, maintainable TypeScript and JavaScript code.
actual_capabilities: Provides Metabase TypeScript and JavaScript coding standards
Defines test execution patterns for JavaScript and ClojureScript
limitations: Does not execute code or run commands directly
Does not modify files or project configuration

use_cases.title: Apply coding standards
use_cases.description: Frontend developers writing TypeScript code in Metabase projects follow established patterns and conventions.

use_cases.title: Write compliant code
use_cases.description: Contributors adding features to Metabase ensure their code meets project standards before submission.

use_cases.title: Generate standards-compliant code
use_cases.description: AI coding assistants produce TypeScript code that matches Metabase codebase conventions and quality requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic TypeScript task
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a TypeScript function that handles user authentication with proper typing following Metabase standards.

prompt_templates.title: Add tests first
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a failing unit test first for a new component, then implement the component to make the test pass.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor existing code
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this TypeScript component to use modern patterns and meet Metabase coding standards while maintaining functionality.

prompt_templates.title: Full feature development
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a new feature including tests, type checking, and linting. Work in small increments and run tests continuously.

output_examples.input: Write a TypeScript utility function for date formatting
output: Added proper TypeScript types for date parameters and return values
Added unit tests following the test-first approach
Verified with yarn lint-eslint-pure and yarn type-check-pure

best_practices: Add failing tests first, then implement to make them pass
Run linting and type checking continuously during development
Understand existing patterns before implementing new code
anti_patterns: Implementing large features without incremental testing

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for TypeScript development assistance.

faq.question: What TypeScript version is supported?
faq.answer: The skill follows Metabase TypeScript standards compatible with the project's TypeScript version.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my project?
faq.answer: Use the provided command templates with yarn commands like yarn lint-eslint-pure and yarn type-check-pure.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation and prompts. It does not access, transmit, or store any external data.

faq.question: Why are my linting commands failing?
faq.answer: Ensure you are in the project root and have run yarn install. Check that your code follows the patterns in existing files.

faq.question: How does this compare to other TypeScript skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on Metabase coding standards. Use it when contributing to Metabase; use general TypeScript skills for other projects.
